description: Old Kent Road Arts Club is a community project space that lives inside an old sofa shop on Old Kent Road. Come and see how we've transformed this vacant retail space into a thriving creative hub that offers free activities for all ages.

factsheet.heading: The Building
paragraphs: The building is actually a small group of post-war buildings, one of which used to be a printing press. At some point, a unifying metal shopfront was added, so that they appear to be a contemporary retail building. For a while the building was a HSS Hire Shop and more recently Fabb Sofas.

In 2020, Arebyte Studios, a charitable artists studio provider, took on the vacant building as a 'meanwhile space' and created approximately 50 units within it. The arts collective F.A.T. Studio CIC leased the unit that sits right at the front of the building. Then in 2021 F.A.T. Studio ran a successful crowdfunding campaign which allowed them to transform the unit into a community-focussed project space that is named Old Kent Road Arts Club.

factsheet.heading: Old Kent Road Arts Club
paragraphs: Old Kent Road (OKR) Arts Club is a space for people living and working on Old Kent Road to get together, share skills and enjoy community life. The programme is an eclectic mix of free, regular clubs for teenagers and adults as well as community-led events and exhibitions.

factsheet.heading: F.A.T. Studio CIC
paragraphs: F.A.T. Studio CIC is a not-for-profit creative studio. It's run by 6 friends who have different creative practices but a shared enthusiasm for community life and DIY culture. Old Kent Road Arts Club is their biggest project yet.

factsheet.heading: The Open City Event
paragraphs: For Open City 2022, Old Kent Road Arts Club will open its doors so that the public can come and see how F.A.T. Studio has invigorated a vacant retail space with a very small budget. There will also be a display of creative work that has been made by local people at the Old Kent Road Arts Club since it opened in July 2021.
